column5: A group of us are looking at setting up a trip that isn't to far north of the MN border and have heard good things about the Morson area on Lake of the Woods. I am wondering where is a good place to stay in that area? We don't need much since the point of the trip is to fish. Something cheap, simple and well kept, we will do all of our own cooking. Any help would be much appreciated.
Tplens pelican landing or first nation guides. both are real reasonable and nice accomodations....eh

Well, the best musky place would probably Tamarak. www.tamarackislandwildernesslodge.com If you want Walleye fishing Toltonswww.milesbaycamp.com If you want to stay on the mainland, Mylies Placewww.myliesplaceresort.com All are very reasonably priced housekeeping resorts.
Thanks for the suggestions, looks like some nice places.

Been staying at Buena Vista Resort in Morson most of my life and love it. Have visited the other camps and they all have they're own mystic, just like the accomodations and folks at BVR. Check in advance though, cause they are heavily booked this time of year.
